s0121: Duke Gong's second year, Chu attacked Zheng.
s0122: In the ninth year, Duke Gong died, and his son the Prince of Yu succeeded him, becoming Duke Cheng.
s0123: Duke Li first ascended the throne for four years, then fled and resided in Li. He resided in Li for seventeen years, then returned and ascended again, reigning seven years. His exile totaled twenty-eight years.
s0124: In the twenty-fourth year, Duke Wen's lowly concubine named Yan Ji dreamed that Heaven gave her an orchid, saying: 'I am Bo Xiao.
s0126: With this as your son, the orchid will have the fragrance of a state.'
s0127: She told the dream to Duke Wen, who favored her and gave her an orchid plant as a token.
s0128: Thus she gave birth to a son, named Lan.
s0129: In the thirty-sixth year, Duke Chong Er of Jin passed through, and Duke Wen did not treat him with courtesy.
s0130: Duke Wen's younger brother Uncle Zhan said: 'Chong Er is worthy, and moreover we are of the same surname. He is destitute and passing through your domain - you cannot treat him discourteously.'
s0131: Duke Wen said: 'Exiled princes of feudal lords who pass through are many - how can I treat them all with courtesy!'
s0132: Zhan said: 'If your lordship does not treat him with courtesy, then kill him;
s0133: if you do not kill him, let him return to his state - it will become a worry for Zheng.'
s0135: In the thirty-seventh year, spring, Duke Chong Er of Jin returned to his state and ascended the throne, becoming Duke Wen.
s0136: Autumn, Zheng entered Hua, and Hua submitted, but then rebelled and allied with Wei, so Zheng attacked Hua.
s0137: King Xiang of Zhou sent Bo Fu to request on behalf of Hua.
s0138: Duke Wen of Zheng resented that King Hui had fled to Li, and his father Duke Li had welcomed him, but King Hui did not grant Duke Li rank or salary. He also resented King Xiang for giving Wei and Hua to them, so he did not listen to King Xiang's request and imprisoned Bo Fu.
s0139: The king was angry and allied with the Di people to attack Zheng, but they were not victorious.
s0140: Winter, the Di attacked and drove out King Xiang, who fled to Zheng. Duke Wen of Zheng housed the king at Fan.
s0141: In the thirty-eighth year, Duke Wen of Jin entered King Xiang into Cheng Zhou.
s0142: In the forty-first year, Zheng assisted Chu in attacking Jin.
s0143: Because Duke Wen of Jin had passed through without courtesy, Zheng turned against Jin and assisted Chu.
s0144: In the forty-third year, Duke Wen of Jin and Duke Mu of Qin together besieged Zheng, to punish Zheng for assisting Chu in attacking Jin, and for the discourtesy when Duke Wen passed through.
s0145: Initially, Duke Wen of Zheng had three wives and five favored sons, all of whom died young due to crimes.
s0146: The duke was angry and drove away all the princes.
s0147: Zi Lan fled to Jin and followed Duke Wen of Jin in besieging Zheng.
s0148: At the time, Lan served Duke Wen of Jin very carefully and was loved and favored by him, so he secretly negotiated with Jin to seek entry into Zheng as crown prince.
s0149: Jin thus wanted to obtain Uncle Zhan to kill him.
s0150: Duke Wen of Zheng was afraid and did not dare speak to Uncle Zhan.
s0151: Zhan heard and said to the lord of Zheng: 'I advised your lordship, but your lordship did not listen. Jin has become a threat.
s0152: However, the reason Jin besieges Zheng is because of Zhan. If Zhan dies and Zheng is pardoned, that is Zhan's wish.'
s0154: The people of Zheng gave Zhan's corpse to Jin.
s0155: Duke Wen of Jin said: 'I must see the lord of Zheng to humiliate him, then leave.'
s0156: The people of Zheng were troubled and sent someone to secretly tell Qin: 'If Zheng is broken, Jin will benefit - this is not advantageous for Qin.'
s0158: Duke Wen of Jin wanted to enter Lan as crown prince and informed Zheng.
s0159: The Zheng grand master Shi Gui said: 'I have heard that the Ji surname is the first wife of Hou Ji, and their descendants should have rising ones.
s0160: Zi Lan's mother is their descendant.
s0161: Moreover, the sons of the wife have all died, and among the remaining illegitimate sons, none is as worthy as Lan.
s0162: Now the siege is urgent, and Jin requests this on our behalf - what benefit could be greater!'
s0163: Thus Zheng agreed to Jin and formed an alliance, finally establishing Zi Lan as crown prince. The Jin troops then withdrew.
s0164: In the forty-fifth year, Duke Wen died, and Zi Lan ascended the throne, becoming Duke Mu.
s0165: In Duke Mu's first year, spring, Duke Mu of Qin sent three generals leading troops intending to attack Zheng by surprise, reaching Hua. They encountered the Zheng merchant Xian Gao, who deceived them by presenting twelve oxen to refresh the army, so the Qin troops did not arrive and returned. Jin defeated them at Xiao.
s0166: Initially, in previous years when Duke Wen of Zheng died, the Zheng Director of Construction Zheng He betrayed Zheng's situation and sold it to Qin, which is why the Qin troops came.
s0167: In the third year, Zheng sent troops to follow Jin in attacking Qin, defeating the Qin troops at Wang.
s0168: In previous years, the Chu crown prince Shang Chen assassinated his father Cheng Wang and replaced him on the throne.
s0169: In the twenty-first year, Chu allied with Song's Hua Yuan to attack Zheng.
s0170: Hua Yuan killed a sheep and fed the soldiers, but did not give any to his charioteer Yang Zhen. Yang Zhen was angry and charged into Zheng, where Zheng imprisoned Hua Yuan.
s0171: Song ransomed Hua Yuan, who also fled away.
s0172: Jin sent Zhao Chuan with troops to attack Zheng.
s0174: In the twenty-eighth year, Qin attacked Zheng.
s0175: In the thirty-first year, Chu attacked Zheng.
s0176: In the thirty-third year, Duke Mu died, and his son Ning succeeded him, becoming Duke Ling.
s0177: Duke Ling's first year, Qin attacked Zheng.
s0178: In the third year, Duke Ling died, and his son the Prince of Gong succeeded him, becoming Duke Xiang.
s0179: Duke Xiang's first year, Qin attacked Zheng.
s0180: In the fifth year, Duke Xiang died, and his son the Prince of Chou succeeded him, becoming Duke Jian.
